text: OD Copy Paste External - Special Houdini HDA Edition
Enables you to quickly send Geometry to Houdini and back.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
Overview
OD CopyPaste allows you to quickly copy and paste geometry from one application to another.  The open source version can be found here: https://github.com/heimlich1024/OD_CopyPasteExternal
Operations
Send (Copy To External)
Copies the current houdini data to external.
Receive (Paste From External)
Pastes the external data into houdini.
Settings
Copy/Paste Nodes instead of Geometry - Enter HDA - (HOUDINI EXCHANGE ONLY)

Instead of pasting the input geometry it will paste the node setup inside of the HDA.  If you use custom HDAs inside, all parties pasting back the information will need to have those HDA’s in their houdini session.
Bundle Externals (Geometry Files / Images / etc - CAREFUL, depending on the # of assets, can be slow)
Packages all the externals as well.  They will be restored in the external Storade dir (by default, in the HIP location / Node Name.
Externals Storage Dir
Where you want external files to be stored when pasting from External.
Use Non-Standard Share Location

By Default, the temporary file is saved in the %Temp% folder.  You can override this by setting the file handle here.  It is important to note, that Houdini makes its own temp folder within the temp folder, which is why by default this tool is pointing one folder up, so that it matches what other applications have.  You need to make sure if you change it, that other DCC applications access the same path.  On Windows, $TEMP resolves to a houdini_temp folder within the temp folder.  So sharing with other applications, you would want to do a $temp/../ to get back to the main temp folder.
Share Location

The Path, i.e. a network path or a dropbox share so that the copy paste functionality will go beyond the local machine.  This way you can have multiple files for different users/sessions on the same system/network as an example
Use Remote FTP
You also have the ability to use an FTP as temporary exchange
FTP Location
FTP Host Name
FTP Username
FTP Username to login to the location
FTP Password
FTP Password for above username/login.
FTP File Name
The Filename of the temporary shared file.  This way you can have multiple files for different users/sessions on the same FTP as an example
Tips & Possible Issue Resolution
Should you get any permission problems, simply remove your houdini_temp folder, restart Houdini and try again.

title: OD Copy Paste External - Special Houdini HDA Edition
summary: Enables you to quickly send Geometry to Houdini and back.  Any Questions, recommendations or bugs, email Oliver Hotz @ oliver@heimlich.net.
